Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Rev. Deborah Jenkins, Pastor, Faith at Work Christian Church, 177 Dreiser Loop, Bronx, N.Y. 10475.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member King.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by:Rev. Deborah Jenkins, Pastor, Faith at Worl's Christian Church, 177 Dreiser Loop, the Bronx, N.Y. 10475.



Council Member King moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of November 24, 2015 be adopted as printed by Council Member Palma.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Palma moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of November 24, 2015 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor
Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the name of Hope Knight for appointment as a member of the New York City Planning Commission pursuant to §§ 31 and 192(a) of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections
Items.MatterName: Hope Knight, City Planning Commission

Items.Title: Communications from City, County & Borough Offices

Communication from the Office of Management & Budget – Transfer City funds between various agencies in Fiscal Year 2016 to implement changes to the City's expense budget, pursuant to Section 107(b) of the New York City Charter. (MN-2).
Items.ActionText: This Communication was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Transfer City funds between various agencies in FY'16 to implement changes to the City's expense budget. (MN-2).

Items.Title: Communication from the Office of Management & Budget – Appropriation of new revenues of $304.2 million in Fiscal Year 2016, pursuant to Section 107(e) of the New York City Charter. (MN-3)
Items.ActionText: This Communication was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Appropriation of new revenues of $304.2 million in FY'16.  (MN-3)

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By Council Member Mendez:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and §20-226 or §20-225 of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 220 Park Avenue South, Borough of Manhattan, Community Board No. 5, Application No. 20165181 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: This Land Use Call-Up was Approved, by Council
Items.MatterName: Zoning, Sidewalk café, 220 Park Ave South, Manhattan (20165181 TCM)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Mendez:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and §20-226 or §20-225 of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 176 2nd Avenue, Borough of Manhattan, Community Board No. 3, Application No. 20165189 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, Sidewalk café, 176 2nd Ave, Manhattan (20165189 TCM)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Mendez:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and §20-226 or §20-225 of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 233 East 14th Street, Borough of Manhattan, Community Board No. 6, Application No. 20165190 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, Sidewalk café, 233 E. 14th St., Manhattan (20165190 TCM)

Items.Title: Resolution authorizing the Speaker to file or join an amicus brief on behalf of the Council in the litigation captioned Avella, et al. v. City of New York, et al., currently on appeal at the New York Court of Appeals, No. APL-2015-00298, to support the prior approval of the Willets Point development plan by the City Council.
Items.AgendaNote: Preconsidered - Adopted by the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.



The following 2 Council Members formally voted against this item:  Council Members Lancman and Vallone;
The following Council Member formally abstained to vote on this item:  Council Member Grodenchik.



Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Authorizing the Speaker to file or join an amicus brief on behalf of the Council in the litigation captioned Avella v City of New York, et al., currently on appeal at the New York Court of Appeals, No. APL-2015-00298, to support the prior approval of the

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

Resolution calling on the United States Supreme Court to issue a decision in United States v. Texas that overturns the Fifth Circuit’s ruling in Texas v. United States, and upholds the implementation of President Obama’s expanded DACA and DAPA programs.

Items.MatterName: US Supreme Court to issue a decision in United States v. Texas that overturns the Fifth Circuit’s ruling in Texas v. United States, and upholds the implementation of President Obama’s expanded DACA and DAPA programs.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the U.S. Congress to pass and the President to sign H.R. 1989 or the “ENLIST Act,” which would allow undocumented immigrants to enlist in the Armed Forces and provide a mechanism by which such individuals may be lawfully admitted to the United States for permanent residence.

Items.MatterName: Establish and administer “Care Cards” that foster parents can use to receive, spend, and track monthly foster care stipends.
